body.p: Obviously, you're going to need Microsoft's .NET Framework SDK installed on your machine.

In order to compile the generated HTML files into a CHM file, you're going to need the HTML Help Compiler (hhc.exe) which can be found in Microsoft's HTML Help Workshop. If you've installed Visual Studio .NET then you probably already have this (look for the C:\Program Files\HTML Help Workshop\ folder).

To get the latest sources, check them out of CVS. Since this code is under active development, it might not be in perfect working condition (even though we try really hard not to check something in if it doesn't work).
For those of you who don't want to (or can't) use CVS but still want the latest bits, we automatically archive the code in CVS every morning at 3 AM and make it available for download.
If you'd rather use a more "stable" release, you can download the older release from SourceForge.
We also have a web setup release which you can install by clicking here.
